definition: to destroy/to spoil/to ruin/to injure/cruel/oppressive/savage/brutal/incomplete/disabled/to remain/to survive/remnant/surplus

sentences.english: A common result of depression is self-destructive behavior.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁的一个常见后果就是自残行为。

sentences.english: Is it self-mutilation when you're getting a better limb?
sentences.chinese: 当你获得的是更好用的肢体时，这还算是自残吗？

sentences.english: The most obvious harms from self-injury arise from the wounds themselves, which pose a risk of infection.
sentences.chinese: 自残的最明显伤害来自于伤口导致的被感染的风险。

sentences.english: Therefore, all threats of self-harm should be taken seriously.
sentences.chinese: 因此，应严肃对待所有自残威胁。

sentences.english: Most self-injurers would like to choose cutting wrists.
sentences.chinese: 很多自残者都会选择割腕。

sentences.english: Peer group influence can also make youngsters more vulnerable to self-harm.
sentences.chinese: 同类人的影响也可导致青少年更容易自残。

sentences.english: His behavior ranged from self-injury to aggression against others.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为由自残改变为对于他人的侵略性。

sentences.english: The most common method of self-harming was a drug overdose.
sentences.chinese: 自残最主要的方法是过量服药。

sentences.english: When she got home after a natural feel closed rules live up to his father head hit the wall body self-harm.
sentences.chinese: 当一然回家后，觉得收规愧对父亲将头撞向墙身自残。

definition: to kill oneself/to commit suicide/to attempt suicide
to torment/to abuse (an animal, child etc)
to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to be obsessed with sth/to go overboard/(Buddhism, Taoism) to misguidedly focus on hallucinations that arise during meditation
to harm sb/to inflict suffering/to victimize/pernicious
